00028 #include <obd.h>
00029 #include <lustre_quota.h>
00030 
00031 #ifndef _LQUOTA_INTERNAL_H
00032 #define _LQUOTA_INTERNAL_H
00033 
00034 #define QTYPE_NAME(qtype) ((qtype) == USRQUOTA ? "usr" : "grp")
00035 #define RES_NAME(res) ((res) == LQUOTA_RES_MD ? "md" : "dt")
00036 
00037 #define QIF_IFLAGS (QIF_INODES | QIF_ITIME | QIF_ILIMITS)
00038 #define QIF_BFLAGS (QIF_SPACE | QIF_BTIME | QIF_BLIMITS)
00039 
00040 /* The biggest filename are the one used for slave index which are in the form
00041  * of 0x%x-%s,glb_fid.f_oid,slv_uuid, that's to say:
00042  * 2(0x) + 8(f_oid) + 1(-) + 40(UUID_MAX) which means 51 chars + '\0' */
00043 #define LQUOTA_NAME_MAX 52
00044 
00045 /* reserved OID in FID_SEQ_QUOTA for local objects */
00046 enum lquota_local_oid {
00047         LQUOTA_USR_OID          = 1UL, /* slave index copy for user quota */
00048         LQUOTA_GRP_OID          = 2UL, /* slave index copy for group quota */
00049         /* all OIDs after this are allocated dynamically by the QMT */
00050         LQUOTA_GENERATED_OID    = 4096UL,
00051 };
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * lquota_entry support
00055  */
00056 
00057 /* Common operations supported by a lquota_entry */
00058 struct lquota_entry_operations {
00059         /* Initialize specific fields of a lquota entry */
00060         void (*lqe_init)(struct lquota_entry *, void *arg);
00061 
00062         /* Read quota settings from disk and update lquota entry */
00063         int (*lqe_read)(const struct lu_env *, struct lquota_entry *,
00064                         void *arg);
00065 
00066         /* Print debug information about a given lquota entry */
00067         void (*lqe_debug)(struct lquota_entry *, void *,
00068                           struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *, const char *,
00069                           va_list);
00070 };
00071 
00072 /* Per-ID information specific to the quota master target */
00073 struct lquota_mst_entry {
00074         /* global hard limit, in inodes or kbytes */
00075         __u64                   lme_hardlimit;
00076 
00077         /* global quota soft limit, in inodes or kbytes */
00078         __u64                   lme_softlimit;
00079 
00080         /* grace time, in seconds */
00081         __u64                   lme_gracetime;
00082 
00083         /* last time we glimpsed */
00084         __u64                   lme_revoke_time;
00085 
00086         /* r/w semaphore used to protect concurrent access to the quota
00087          * parameters which are stored on disk */
00088         struct rw_semaphore     lme_sem;
00089 
00090         /* quota space that may be released after glimpse */
00091         __u64                   lme_may_rel;
00092 };
00093 
00094 /* Per-ID information specific to the quota slave */
00095 struct lquota_slv_entry {
00096         /* [ib]tune size, inodes or kbytes */
00097         __u64                   lse_qtune;
00098 
00099         /* per-ID lock handle */
00100         struct lustre_handle    lse_lockh;
00101 
00102         /* pending write which were granted quota space but haven't completed
00103          * yet, in inodes or kbytes. */
00104         __u64                   lse_pending_write;
00105 
00106         /* writes waiting for quota space, in inodes or kbytes. */
00107         __u64                   lse_waiting_write;
00108 
00109         /* pending release, in inodes or kbytes */
00110         __u64                   lse_pending_rel;
00111 
00112         /* pending dqacq/dqrel requests. */
00113         unsigned int            lse_pending_req;
00114 
00115         /* rw spinlock protecting in-memory counters (i.e. lse_pending*) */
00116         rwlock_t                lse_lock;
00117 
00118         /* waiter for pending request done */
00119         wait_queue_head_t       lse_waiters;
00120 
00121         /* hint on current on-disk usage, in inodes or kbytes */
00122         __u64                   lse_usage;
00123 
00124         /* time to trigger quota adjust */
00125         __u64                   lse_adjust_time;
00126 
00127         /* return code of latest acquire RPC */
00128         int                     lse_acq_rc;
00129 
00130         /* when latest acquire RPC completed */
00131         __u64                   lse_acq_time;
00132 
00133         /* when latest edquot set */
00134         __u64                   lse_edquot_time;
00135 };
00136 
00137 /* In-memory entry for each enforced quota id
00138  * A lquota_entry structure belong to a single lquota_site */
00139 struct lquota_entry {
00140         /* link to site hash table */
00141         struct hlist_node        lqe_hash;
00142 
00143         /* quota identifier associated with this entry */
00144         union lquota_id          lqe_id;
00145 
00146         /* site this quota entry belongs to */
00147         struct lquota_site      *lqe_site;
00148 
00149         /* reference counter */
00150         atomic_t                 lqe_ref;
00151 
00152         /* linked to list of lqes which:
00153          * - need quota space adjustment on slave
00154          * - need glimpse to be sent on master */
00155         struct list_head         lqe_link;
00156 
00157         /* current quota settings/usage of this ID */
00158         __u64           lqe_granted; /* granted limit, inodes or kbytes */
00159         __u64           lqe_qunit; /* [ib]unit size, inodes or kbytes */
00160         union {
00161                 struct  lquota_mst_entry me; /* params specific to QMT */
00162                 struct  lquota_slv_entry se; /* params specific to QSD */
00163         } u;
00164 
00165         /* flags describing the state of the lquota_entry */
00166         unsigned long   lqe_enforced:1,/* quota enforced or not */
00167                         lqe_uptodate:1,/* successfully read from disk */
00168                         lqe_edquot:1,  /* id out of quota space on QMT */
00169                         lqe_gl:1,      /* glimpse is in progress */
00170                         lqe_nopreacq:1;/* pre-acquire disabled */
00171 };
00172 
00173 /* Compartment within which lquota_entry are unique.
00174  * lquota_entry structures are kept in a hash table and read from disk if not
00175  * present.  */
00176 struct lquota_site {
00177         /* Hash table storing lquota_entry structures */
00178         struct cfs_hash *lqs_hash;
00179 
00180         /* Quota type, either user or group. */
00181         int              lqs_qtype;
00182 
00183         /* Record whether this site is for a QMT or a slave */
00184         int              lqs_is_mst;
00185 
00186         /* Vector of operations which can be done on lquota entry belonging to
00187          * this quota site */
00188         struct lquota_entry_operations  *lqs_ops;
00189 
00190         /* Backpointer to parent structure, either QMT pool info for master or
00191          * QSD for slave */
00192         void            *lqs_parent;
00193 };
00194 
00195 #define lqe_hardlimit           u.me.lme_hardlimit
00196 #define lqe_softlimit           u.me.lme_softlimit
00197 #define lqe_gracetime           u.me.lme_gracetime
00198 #define lqe_revoke_time         u.me.lme_revoke_time
00199 #define lqe_sem                 u.me.lme_sem
00200 #define lqe_may_rel             u.me.lme_may_rel
00201 
00202 #define lqe_qtune               u.se.lse_qtune
00203 #define lqe_pending_write       u.se.lse_pending_write
00204 #define lqe_waiting_write       u.se.lse_waiting_write
00205 #define lqe_pending_rel         u.se.lse_pending_rel
00206 #define lqe_pending_req         u.se.lse_pending_req
00207 #define lqe_waiters             u.se.lse_waiters
00208 #define lqe_lock                u.se.lse_lock
00209 #define lqe_usage               u.se.lse_usage
00210 #define lqe_adjust_time         u.se.lse_adjust_time
00211 #define lqe_lockh               u.se.lse_lockh
00212 #define lqe_acq_rc              u.se.lse_acq_rc
00213 #define lqe_acq_time            u.se.lse_acq_time
00214 #define lqe_edquot_time         u.se.lse_edquot_time
00215 
00216 #define LQUOTA_BUMP_VER 0x1
00217 #define LQUOTA_SET_VER  0x2
00218 
00219 extern struct kmem_cache *lqe_kmem;
00220 
00221 /* helper routine to get/put reference on lquota_entry */
00222 static inline void lqe_getref(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00223 {
00224         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00225         atomic_inc(&lqe->lqe_ref);
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline void lqe_putref(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00229 {
00230         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00231         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lqe->lqe_ref) > 0);
00232         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&lqe->lqe_ref))
00233                 OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(lqe, lqe_kmem);
00234 }
00235 
00236 static inline int lqe_is_master(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00237 {
00238         return lqe->lqe_site->lqs_is_mst;
00239 }
00240 
00241 /* lqe locking helpers */
00242 static inline void lqe_write_lock(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00243 {
00244         if (lqe_is_master(lqe))
00245                 down_write(&lqe->lqe_sem);
00246         else
00247                 write_lock(&lqe->lqe_lock);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline void lqe_write_unlock(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00251 {
00252         if (lqe_is_master(lqe))
00253                 up_write(&lqe->lqe_sem);
00254         else
00255                 write_unlock(&lqe->lqe_lock);
00256 }
00257 
00258 static inline void lqe_read_lock(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00259 {
00260         if (lqe_is_master(lqe))
00261                 down_read(&lqe->lqe_sem);
00262         else
00263                 read_lock(&lqe->lqe_lock);
00264 }
00265 
00266 static inline void lqe_read_unlock(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00267 {
00268         if (lqe_is_master(lqe))
00269                 up_read(&lqe->lqe_sem);
00270         else
00271                 read_unlock(&lqe->lqe_lock);
00272 }
00273 
00274 /*
00275  * Helper functions & prototypes
00276  */
00277 
00278 /* minimum qunit size, 1K inode for metadata pool and 1MB for data pool */
00279 #define LQUOTA_LEAST_QUNIT(type) \
00280         (type == LQUOTA_RES_MD ? (1 << 10) : toqb(OFD_MAX_BRW_SIZE))
00281 
00282 #define LQUOTA_OVER_FL(type) \
00283         (type == USRQUOTA ? QUOTA_FL_OVER_USRQUOTA : QUOTA_FL_OVER_GRPQUOTA)
00284 
00285 /* Common data shared by quota-level handlers. This is allocated per-thread to
00286  * reduce stack consumption */
00287 struct lquota_thread_info {
00288         union  lquota_rec       qti_rec;
00289         struct lu_buf           qti_lb;
00290         struct lu_attr          qti_attr;
00291         struct dt_object_format qti_dof;
00292         struct lustre_mdt_attrs qti_lma;
00293         struct lu_fid           qti_fid;
00294         char                    qti_buf[LQUOTA_NAME_MAX];
00295 };
00296 
00297 #define qti_glb_rec     qti_rec.lqr_glb_rec
00298 #define qti_acct_rec    qti_rec.lqr_acct_rec
00299 #define qti_slv_rec     qti_rec.lqr_slv_rec
00300 
00301 #define LQUOTA_BUMP_VER 0x1
00302 #define LQUOTA_SET_VER  0x2
00303 
00304 extern struct lu_context_key lquota_thread_key;
00305 
00306 /* extract lquota_threa_info context from environment */
00307 static inline
00308 struct lquota_thread_info *lquota_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00309 {
00310         struct lquota_thread_info       *info;
00311 
00312         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &lquota_thread_key);
00313         if (info == NULL) {
00314                 lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
00315                 info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &lquota_thread_key);
00316         }
00317         LASSERT(info);
00318         return info;
00319 }
00320 
00321 #define req_is_acq(flags)    ((flags & QUOTA_DQACQ_FL_ACQ) != 0)
00322 #define req_is_preacq(flags) ((flags & QUOTA_DQACQ_FL_PREACQ) != 0)
00323 #define req_is_rel(flags)    ((flags & QUOTA_DQACQ_FL_REL) != 0)
00324 #define req_has_rep(flags)   ((flags & QUOTA_DQACQ_FL_REPORT) != 0)

00326 /* debugging macros */
00327 #ifdef LIBCFS_DEBUG
00328 #define lquota_lqe_debug(msgdata, mask, cdls, lqe, fmt, a...) do {      \
00329         CFS_CHECK_STACK(msgdata, mask, cdls);                           \
00330                                                                         \
00331         if (((mask) & D_CANTMASK) != 0 ||                               \
00332             ((libcfs_debug & (mask)) != 0 &&                            \
00333              (libcfs_subsystem_debug & DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM) != 0))          \
00334                 lquota_lqe_debug0(lqe, msgdata, fmt, ##a);              \
00335 } while(0)
00336 
00337 void lquota_lqe_debug0(struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00338                        struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *data, const char *fmt, ...)
00339         __attribute__ ((format (printf, 3, 4)));
00340 
00341 #define LQUOTA_DEBUG_LIMIT(mask, lqe, fmt, a...) do {                          \
00342         static struct cfs_debug_limit_state _lquota_cdls;                      \
00343         LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, mask, &_lquota_cdls);              \
00344         lquota_lqe_debug(&msgdata, mask, &_lquota_cdls, lqe, "$$$ "fmt" ",     \
00345                          ##a);                                                 \
00346 } while (0)
00347 
00348 #define LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, fmt, a...) LQUOTA_DEBUG_LIMIT(D_ERROR, lqe, fmt, ## a)
00349 #define LQUOTA_WARN(lqe, fmt, a...) \
00350         LQUOTA_DEBUG_LIMIT(D_WARNING, lqe, fmt, ## a)
00351 #define LQUOTA_CONSOLE(lqe, fmt, a...) \
00352         LQUOTA_DEBUG_LIMIT(D_CONSOLE, lqe, fmt, ## a)
00353 
00354 #define LQUOTA_DEBUG(lock, fmt, a...) do {                                 \
00355         LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_QUOTA, NULL);                \
00356         lquota_lqe_debug(&msgdata, D_QUOTA, NULL, lqe, "$$$ "fmt" ", ##a); \
00357 } while (0)
00358 #else /* !LIBCFS_DEBUG */
00359 # define LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, fmt, a...) ((void)0)
00360 # define LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, fmt, a...) ((void)0)
00361 # define LQUOTA_WARN(lqe, fmt, a...) ((void)0)
00362 # define LQUOTA_CONSOLE(lqe, fmt, a...) ((void)0)
00363 # define lquota_lqe_debug(cdls, level, lqe, file, func, line, fmt, a...) \
00364                 ((void)0)
00365 #endif
